full_summary:
### Invitation to Qualify for the Esther Lord Abatement and Demolition Contract
#### Overview

The Department of Public Works and Government Services invites contractors to qualify for the Esther Lord Abatement and Demolition contract in St. Andrews, New Brunswick. The tender is a single-stage procurement under the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

#### Key Information

* **Notice Reference Number (NRN):** WS4455832021-DOC4463317852
* **Publication Date:** February 27, 2024
* **Tender Closing Date:** March 13, 2024 at 14:00 (Eastern Time)
* **Notice Type:** Invitation to Qualify

#### Contract Information

* **Contract Scope:** Demolition services
* **Estimated Contract Value:** As specified in the tender documents
* **Expected Contract Start Date:** April 1, 2024
* **Expected Contract End Date:** May 15, 2024
* **Procurement Method:** Competitive - Open Bidding
* **Selection Criteria:** Lowest Price

#### Contact Information

* **Contact Name:** Kate Mintzer (SPAC/PSPC)
* **Contact Email:** [kate.mintzer@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:kate.mintzer@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
* **Notice URL:** https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/18920588?extsite=MTg5MjA1ODhfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

#### Additional Information

The contract will be evaluated on the lowest price submitted. The tender documents can be accessed through the provided notice URL. The deadline for bid submission is March 13, 2024, at 14:00 (Eastern Time). [Estimate the contract value that would be published in the tender documents] 
The contract will be awarded under the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA). You are required to respond to this notice to be considered. This is an open competitive bid and all replies should include statement of qualifications and a signed cover letter.

Don't forget to validate the content with procurement experts.
Attachments are not included; a link is provided to access the tender documents.  Contact them regarding availability of tender specimens. Recognize that the participation of all costs for reply submission of credentials will be the charge of the proponent.
